document.title: Gatekept: Inviting Creative Community Literacy
document.abstract: Creative writing becomes a vehicle for community outreach in a Writing Center setting, bringing together town and gown.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value:
Shelly Sanders, M.F.A. Emerson College, Ph.D. University of Texas Arlington, teaches at Abilene Christian University. Recent stories and poems of hers can be found in Aethlon and Windhover. As a recent participant of The Norman Mailer Writers Colony, she is always looking for another excuse to travel to the East Coast. mrw95v@acu.edu
Cole Bennett is Associate Professor of Language and Literature and Writing Center Director at Abilene Christian University. His main areas of scholarly interest concern Rhetoric-Composition pedagogy, service-learning, and writing center studies. cole.bennett@acu.edu
